description: Episode of Series "The World We Live In". Examines some of the techniques psychologists use to assess mothering practices with young infants. Stresses the importance of touch and movement in young children. Examples of monkeys in isolation, children in orphanages, and premature infants are used to show the effects of various maternal deprivations. Narrated by Dan Ingram. NB: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING IMAGES WITH MONKEYS.
